greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), read by rows: number of Knödel walks starting at 0, ending at k, with n steps.
link: H. Prodinger, The Kernel Method: a collection of examples, Séminaire Lotharingien de Combinatoire, B50f (2004), 19 pp.
formula: G.f.: r(z)/(z(1+z)(1-r(z)))*(1+xzr(z))/(1-xr(z)), with r(z)=(1-sqrt(1-4z^2)/2z. Then the g.f. of the k-th column is r(z)^(k+1)/(z(1-r(z))).
T(n, k) = Sum_{i=0..n} (-1)^(n-i)*C(i, floor(i/2)) for k=0, otherwise T(n, k) = C(n, floor((n-k)/2)).
program: (PARI) T(n, k) = if (k==0, sum(i=0, n, (-1)^(n-i)*binomial(i, i\2)), binomial(n, (n-k)\2));
tabl(nn) = for (n=0, nn, for (k=0, n, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print();); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 04 2016
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 21 2005
